FRANKIE FELICIANO biografia:
Essendo cresciuto in un ambiente ricco di musica e cultura, non c’è da meravigliarsi se Frankie Feliciano è divenuto uno degli esponenti più rispettati e famosi della musica 
house. Esposto sin dalla nascita alla vibrante cultura hip-hop, Frankie ha iniziato la sua carriera a 14 anni mixando e “scratchando”, nel tentativo di imitare ciò che 
ascoltava ai party hip-hop più underground di New York. 
Un paio d’anni più tardi Frankie fu introdotto alla musica house da suo cugino, che lo portò sulla consolle del 
rinomato “Paradise Garage”;
la sua prima esperienza di club fu presso l’Hearthrobs’s, per affiancare l’allora emergente ‘Little Louie’ Vega. Frankie si dedicò anche alle produzioni ispirato dai
giganti Shep Pettibone, Tony Humphries e Timmy Regisford. La sua carriera è esplosa agli inizi degli anni ’90 richiesto dai maggiori club statunitensi, per approdare in seguito 
in Europa. 
I suoi dischi sono tra quelli più venduti al mondo, basta fare una ricerca dei suoi alias (Gigolo Supreme, Gloo Factory, The, Groove Asylum, Halo, Jazzie Joint, Live & Die Reck, Mass, NuLife, Off Ramp, Realthing, Rek Shit Rebelz, Turn-Style) e verrete catapultati nel vero mondo dell'House Music.

----------------------------------------

230440783815045.description:
Il 25 Marzo 1911 bruciava a New York la Triangle Waist Company, una fabbrica di camicette bianche in cui lavoravano in prevalenze donne emigrate e in cui persero la vita 146 persone, di cui 126 donne e ben 38 italiane. 

Per la prima volta in Italia "Camicette bianche. Oltre l’8 marzo" di Ester Rizzo ricorda questa tragedia dimenticata, raccontando le storie delle sue vittime: donne e migranti.
E partendo dalle quelle storie, il Gruppo Toponomastica Femminile con l’autrice Ester Rizzo e l'editore Navarra, ha lanciato un appello nazionale rivolto a tutte le amministrazioni comunali italiane che hanno dato loro i natali affinché ricordino le vite di queste done attraverso l'intitolazione di una piazza, una via, un giardino o altro luogo di pubblico interesse. 

"Camicette bianche. Oltre l’ 8 marzo" verrà presentato in anteprima assoluta a Palermo mercoledì 23 aprile alle 18:30 nella Sala Magna di Palazzo Steri. Intervengono Ottavio Navarra, Ester Rizzo, Giuseppina Tripodi. Modera Silvana Polizzi. Durante l'incontro sarà possibile firmare la petizione pubblica, che in pochi giorni ha già superato i 400 sottoscrittori.

Per ridare dignità alle vittime del rogo e andare “oltre l’8 marzo”, per restituire loro non una memoria indistinta e generica, ma un ricordo tangibile, che abbia la qualità di essere personale e nominale, per riconsegnare alle donne il posto che meritano nella storia del nostro Paese.

Firmate la petizione su https://www.change.org/it/petizioni/franco-curto-ridiamo-dignit%C3%A0-alle-donne-vittime-dell-incendio-della-triangle-waist-2
230440783815045.name: "CAMICETTE BIANCHE. OLTRE L'8 MARZO": UN APPELLO NAZIONALE E UN LIBRO PER RIDARE DIGNITÀ ALLE 38 DONNE ITALIANE VITTIME DELL’INCENDIO DELLA TRIANGLE WAIST DI NEW YORK

232140876986003.description:
Calling on all Facebook Friends to urgently support a Children's Arts Initiative for the young people of Bedford Stuyvesant who will participate as actors and audience members in the April 5 & 6 production of "The Liberation of Mother Goose..." at the Billie Holiday Theatre 1368 FULTON STREET BROOKLYN, New York 11216.  Go to www.dovellc.org...I am asking you to dig a little to donate  to the project coordinators The  Concerned Women of Brooklyn,Inc.(production team  501c3 ) to address production costs for this wonderful opportunity for our youth. Although my kids are adults, I, Dr. Askia Davis Sr., have stepped forward by contributing nearly $1000 because I know of the dire need for our young people in America  to have outlets for creative expression as they prepare to compete with other children who have all of the privileges wealth provides, including Broadway, world travel and enriched arts programs in their schools.

As we used to say in the 1960s and 70s, I know "times are tight." Yet we know the power of the arts in transforming the vision of our children. "The Liberation of Mother Goose" premiered in 1973 at the Billie Holiday Theatre as a play emerging from the Black Arts Movement, which gave us Imari Baraka, Sonia Sanchez, Nickki Giovanni, Maya Angelou and other noteworthy literary visionaries. The play later toured the Kennedy Center and Europe, and its child actors were the leading American contingent participating in the opening festivities of the Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture - known as FESTAC '77- in Lagos, Nigeria! The play has since been updated by its author, Aduke Aremu, and the  world renowned director and choreographer, Abdel Salaam.
This play has been documented by Dr. Jacqui Scott of the University of Wisconsin, as one of the most historic and important children's play for black children in America.


So dig a little and forgo a personal treat so that our children could have an opportunity to dream and express those dreams. Go to www.dovellc.org...to make a sponsor donation and have your name appear in all the playbills and receive invitations to all the upcoming receptions. Thank you for blessing our children.

Dr. Askia Davis Sr. Committee Member-New York

www.dovellc.org (Become a sponsor)

Aduke Aremu
The Stage to TV project for Children
information call 917 319 5203 or text messages  to 678 739 6674

238893732962263.description:
Venerdì 4 aprile 
alle ore 18:30
vi aspettiamo a Spazio Labo' 
per un aperitivo di presentazione della quinta edizione di Photo Workshop in New York! 

Sarà l’occasione per tutti gli interessati ai workshop di raccogliere informazioni e chiarire ogni dubbio sui workshop e sulle borse di studio in palio.
Inoltre, verranno anche presentati i lavori realizzati dagli studenti dei workshop 2013.

Gli studenti che mostreranno i lavori realizzati durante l’edizione 2013 dei workshop sono:
Bea Borgers, Lorenzo Bovi, Cihad Caner, Valentina Casalini, Nadia Del Frate, Alessandra De Sandoli, Zoraida Diaz, Roberta Fuorvia, John Kelly, Nicholas Panizzolo, Alexander Pellegrin, Andree Thorpe, Edwin Torres.

Ingresso libero.


***

Photo Workshop in New York è un progetto educativo che si svolge a New York City, fondato nel 2010 da Laura De Marco e Roberto Alfano, direttori del centro di fotografia Spazio Labo’ a Bologna (Italia).
Ogni anno, Spazio Labo’ riunisce fotografi acclamati a livello internazionale per insegnare in workshop fotografici intensivi di sette giorni a NYC. Tra i docenti delle passate edizioni: Davide Monteleone, Stefano De Luigi, Donna Ferrato, Maurizio Garofalo, Massimo Sciacca, Amy Stein, Erica McDonald, Maggie Steber, Andrew Sullivan, Donald Weber e Jason Eskenazi.

Questi workshop intensivi condotti da professionisti del settore sono mirati allo sviluppo di un progetto fotografico e il loro scopo è dare a studenti e fotografi l’opportunità di sviluppare le proprie capacità all’interno della vivace comunità fotografica di NYC.

La quinta edizione di PWNY si svolgerà dal 22 giugno al 27 luglio 2014. Per festeggiare il quinto anno di questo progetto, Spazio Labo’ propone 5 workshop di 7 giorni ciascuno. I workshop sono aperti a tutti, senza distinzioni di età, nazionalità, sesso ed esperienza fotografica. Tre borse di studio saranno messe a disposizione per fotografi under 26 di tutto il mondo.
I docenti di questa edizione saranno Carolyn Drake & Andres Gonzalez, Brian Ulrich, Erica McDonald, Landon Nordeman, Roberto Alfano & Laura De Marco. La sede dei workshop sarà un loft a Brooklyn, NYC.

Medita New York with Kiril Ravensong
7-8pm

Enlightened Culture presents:
meditate ~ network ~ co-create
8-9pm


About Medita Today:

A choice, a path, a practice. 
A choice to attune your alignment; a way of life.

Medita Today is an integrative method, honoring all paths and perspectives of the divine.

With chapters in over 40 cities throughout the world, Medita New York is a movement. It is a way of life in radical decision to choose the freedom of a consciousness liberating lifestyle.

One hour a day. One day a week.

Medita today is a path of knowledge. Join us to learn a method to meditate for peace, connecting most deeply with your Identity within. Open to those aligned to seeking peace, with attunement to a natural state in full expression of the self.
 
One hour a week. Each week for a month
We will hold a weekly class series every Weds at Studio Anya from 7-8pm.
 
Learn to listen more deeply to the notes of your own personal transformation. 
Come to integrate a new way of seeing and interacting with the world!


About Enlightened Culture:

Enlightened Culture is a platform where diverse communities of change-makers connect. 

meditate ~ network ~ co-create
is a place to connect with the energy of the present time through meditation, and from that "enlightened" space network with other change-makers from diverse communities.
250932698411623.name: Medita New York w/ Kiril Ravensong

251059308397444.description:
The Haunt - Ithaca, NY
Mike Brindisi & The New York Rock
with Falling Hollywood and House of Brian
March 22
Doors open at 8:00 pm
Ages 16+ Only

http://dansmallspresents.com/mike-brindisi-the-new-york-rock


Mike Brindisi is not only an independent recording artist but a true power act. From Writing performing and recording his music, to Acting in film/TV, doing Standup Comedy, to performing/touring all over the United States. Brindisi remains active also by hosting his own Rock radio show on 96.7FM The Vine in Ithaca, NY.

Some of his career highlights include opening for Gavin Degraw, Headlining the NASCAR and INDYCAR races at Watkins Glen international Speedway, collaborating with Legendary Producer Eddie Kramer,being sponsored by Devil May Care Clothing, having his songs played nationally on independent radio stations, and touring markets such as Nashville, New York City, Austin and Philadelphia! He also appeared on the Howard Stern show, had his music video "Crawl" air on the National TV Station "TheCoolTV", recently starred in an independent film, appeared on Saturday Night Live, and was chosen to be a Myspace featured artist on their relaunch!

As an authentic rock artist who has paid his dues from the beginning, he has experienced the "ups and downs" of the industry. But, those experiences have prepared him for his future and opened up doors for him where they appeared closed.

Soon after high school, Brindisi was approached by a record executive who flew him to Nashville, cut a demo, and flopped his record. "I returned home with a broken heart, empty pockets and another tough lesson learned.

I moved to Ithaca, NY because it's an awesome music town (and I didn't have the money to move to NYC or LA)" Brindisi said of the experience.

In 2005 Brindisi started handing out copies of his Demo That he recorded in Nashville. There was a local radio station WBVR, who provided air time for local musicians. Brindisi handed a copy of his demo to the DJ and pleaded with him to play his song "Crawl". The DJ obliged, and the song soared! It was ranked 22 for the most requested song of the year at WBVR.

In the years to come Mike built his following from the ground up starting acoustic and eventually signing with his now manager & building his band. Since then, Mike Brindisi and the New York Rock have been Recording & touring building their fan base immensely. They released their debut album “Counting Pennies” independently in 2009 & then recorded their sophomore album, "Taste" which was released May 11th, 2013.

The single "Show You", from the latest album “Taste” is in rotation on several city radio stations and has reached #1 multiple times on Ithaca's Z95.5 (WFIZ-FM).

Additionally, the New York Rock were asked to write a song for the documentary "Passfire". The song titled "Passfire" will be released February 2014 & featured as the title track of the film in 2015.

"Many dedicated fans and new fans have described Brindisi as "Vivid, Enticing, and Addicting. His Live shows are incomparable."

"No one performs like Mike does. His voice captures you, but his soul envelops you in his relentless rock arena performance. This kid is about to catapult." Mia Tinari, Principal of MCT Entertainment.
251059308397444.name: Mike Brindisi & The New York Rock with Falling Hollywood and House of Brian at The Haunt

251619338358478.description:
Please join artists Tripp Derrick Barnes & Steven Swancoat for a captivating evening as they host their debut PopNeosim event.
-“New SPiN, New POP”-
The event will be held at Susan Sarandon’s SPiN New York. It will be an Art Exhibition & Fundraiser for New York City Kids. 
Info & tickets www.NewSpinNewPop.com

**Pre-Sale Tickets Limited. First Come First Serve!**

Included is unlimited Ping Pong, Live DJ sets, Theatrical Performance by the Lady Circus and one hour of open bar.

The Charity of choice is Art Start. A New York based non-profit founded by artists that raise money to create after-school programs for underserved children throughout the five Boroughs who are interested in the arts and humanities.

This event is open to the public. Feel free to invite all your friends, family and co-workers. A ticket/donation fee of $20 will be asked at the door.

100% of all ticket sales go towards Art Start Charity!!

     Pre-Purchased Tickets Include:

    - VIP access at the door (no waiting in line)
    - Open bar 7-8PM,
    - Unlimited Ping-Pong
    - Live DJ sets
    - Theatrical Performance by The Lady Circus
    - Art Exhibition by Tripp Derrick Barnes & Steven Swancoat 
                    **50% of all painting sales go towards Art Start

The Art Exhibtion will include 30-50 paintings by New York artists Tripp and Steven. All the artwork will be new and in their signature "PopNeoism" style.

PopNeoism evolved from Steven and Tripp’s collaborative work over the past year. The term PopNeoism was coined to describe their new modern and exciting style of art. It's reference is to their combination of abstract expressionism, icons of Pop Art and stencil use of today's biggest street artists. It has since developed to encompass the efforts of a growing group of unique, hard working and creative individuals who desire to help Tripp and Steven use art for common good, thus creating "Team PopNeoism." In 2013 alone, Steven, Tripp and Team PopNeoism raised over $8,400 towards various non-profits using their artwork.

Join us for a night at SPiN full of friends, fundraising, drinks, art, performances and ping pong games!

www.NewSPiNNewPOP.com

^^ORDER TICKETS ON EVENT WEBSITE!^^

SPiN New York: https://newyork.spingalactic.com/

Art Start: http://art-start.org/

Lady Circus: http://ladycircus.com/


The Artists:

Steven Swancoat: www.SwancoatArt.com / Instagram:  @SwancoatArt

Tripp Derrick Barnes: www.PopNeoism.com / Instagram: @Tripp_art

252311948275985.description:
Old School!
Les parrains de la scène hardcore new-yorkaise en concert au Grillen de Colmar le mercredi 06 août 2014.
Agnotic Front débarque pour faire renaître le CBGB'S de ses cendres, préparez-vous à transpirer dans le PIT!
Le hardcore de Spitback pour ouvrir les hostilités.

AGNOSTIC FRONT – New York Hardcore Legends – USA
https://www.facebook.com/agnosticfront?fref=ts
Au début des années 1980, la ville de New-York est en pleine récession, la criminalité très présente et la scène underground connaît une très grande activité. De nombreux jeunes de la classe ouvrière habitant Manhattan et le reste de la ville ont commencé à former des groupes de rock dur  pour lutter contre les épreuves et les dangers de la vie urbaine. Tout droit venu de l’East Side de New-York, le groupe Agnostic Front, père fondateur du punk hardcore new-yorkais est vite devenu un pilier du CBGB, avec à sa tête, Roger Miret et Vinnie Stigma, leader spirituel du mouvement encore de nos jours.

SPITBACK – Hardcore – Fr
https://www.facebook.com/SpitBackmusic?fref=ts
 Efficacité, puissance et énergie sont les mots que revendique SpitBack, groupe de hardcore alsacien. Après un premier 6 titres du nom de "A Fight To Change Your Mind" en 2010, SpitBack revient en 2014 avec un nouvel album "TWO-FACED" !
SpitBack ont crée leur propre style, un mix parfait entre du Hardcore rapide et la vague Beatdown, influencé par la scène aussi bien " New-York roots" que la scène moderne Européene. 
Entre l'amour et la haine , les textes dénoncent la société actuelle, individualiste, froide & mauvaise; mais parlent aussi de la fraternité, de l'amitié et des vrais valeurs.
Puissance & énergie sont les mots revendiqués sur scène, pas de place pour de la fioriture !

Organisation : Zone 51
Lieu : Le Grillen / Colmar - Alsace 
Ouverture des portes : 20h00
Tarifs : 
• Prévente 15€*
• Caisse du soir 18€
*Dans notre billetterie et dans les réseaux habituels - hors frais de location


Plus d'info www.zone51.net

Billy & Katie à Montréal le 18, 19, 20 et vendredi le 21 mars c'est la soirée New York Hustle Night! Ateliers, séminaires et privés disponibles. 

Une chance unique de recevoir les maîtres grâce à la collaboration spéciale de Salsa Olé, Comomango Dance Studio et Salsa Fever.


21h00 Vendredi le 21 mars Soirée: 
NEW YORK HUSTLE NIGHT !
+ Cours d'introduction au Latin Hustle complémentaire ouvert à tous.
+ 2 spectacles
+ DJ DoubleD form Disco Montréal!
Entrée: 10$
=============================
Pour votre cours privé avec Billy ou Katie veuillez contacter VICTOR pour BOOKING 514.214.6177 
victor@comomango.ca
====================================
https://www.facebook.com/events/259085264269810/
====================================
BILLY FAJARDO & KATIE MARLOW, MIAMI.
Les spécialistes B&K se démarquent par leur maîtrise des portées, leur notoriété en tant que coachs des Stars de la danse et comme juges internationaux. Leur expertise est un "must" pour tous danseurs, instructeurs et directeurs ambitieux qui désirent se perfectionner en Bachata/ Salsa/ Cabaret/ Chacha/ portées/ Hustle/ enseignement/ coaching/ direction d'équipe et +.

LE HUSTLE
De ces débuts Rétro-Disco, cet art à deux se distingue par sa lignée similaire à la Salsa, au West-Coast Swing et même au B-Zouk.

De nos jours, cette danse est prisée dans le monde du Hip-Hop, dans les soirées de House uniques à New York, dans le monde de la compétition en Italie et dans le congrès International à Miami. Nul ne doute que le Hustle connait son essor grâce à sa fluidité, son dynamisme et sa sensualité.

Les vrais de vrais "freestylers" nous rappellent l'époque de Rock Steady Crew, de Micheal Jackson, de "Voguing", du Wharehouse à Chicago et la magie de Star Search.

Le fameux “&1-2-3” vous fera ajoutez du "groove" et du "swag" en manipulant les fondations du Ballroom Smooth et Modern.

Apprendre des ambassadeurs incontestables du Hustle est tout un cadeau! Billy & Katie sauront vous transmettre le plaisir et l'excellence de cette danse "underground" à la New Yorkaise!
https://www.facebook.com/events/259085264269810/
 



Exclusivement à Comomango Dance Company du 18 au 21 Mars. Une collaboration spéciale avec Salsa Olé, Comomango Studio et Salsa Fever.
259085264269810.name: Billy & Katie VENDREDI 21 MARS Soirée New York Hustle Night avec DJ DoubleD! Ateliers et privés. Le 18, 19, 20 et 21 mars.

259167584255001.description:
Panel Discussion with leading student activists in Taiwan's Anti-Trade Pact Movement, Wei Yang (魏揚) and Huang Yu-Fen (黃郁芬),  and scholars of globalization in NYC

Time: 4/12, 10am - 1pm
Location: CUNY Graduate Center (365 5th Ave)
                   Room 5414 (5th floor)

*The event is free. Please bring a valid photo id (e.g., drivers' license, passport) to be checked in at the front door.

RSVP form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1xBQnmw5AZKRYS9X9GsUUUfob7EiSWSWl4Q8kG2VpF44/viewform

From March 18 to April 10, tens of thousands of protestors occupied Taiwan's Congress for 24 days and shocked the world. They demand the government's Cross-Strait Services Trade Agreement with China be legal and transparent. This very recent movement mobilized millions of people in Taiwan and overseas, and brought the people to heated debates of the economy and national sovereignty for the first time in these two decades. With the visit of  two leading student activists, Wei Yang and Huang Yu-Fen, to provide their experience and insight, this panel looks into the movement in the broader context of capitalist globalization and East Asian geopolitics.

The panel invites academics and activists who theorize globalization, East Asian societies, labor relations, and activism in response to the actual working of capitalism in our time. This event also invites the general public to join us in a discussion, to reflect on the horizon and possible actions in response to the increasing crisis of global capitalism.

Panel Schedule:

10:00     The Anti-Service Trade Pact Movement in Taiwan 
              Huang, Yu-fen (Activist, Master student of 
              Sociology, Tsing Hua U.)     

10:20      East Asian Activism in A Global Context 
              Rebecca Karl (Prof. of History & East Asian 
              Studies, NYU)
              Hsiu-Hua Shen (Prof. of Sociology, Tsing 
              University; Visiting scholar of Columbia University)

11:00    Brief of Occupy Congress in Taipei   
             Wei, Yang (Activist, Master student of Sociology,
             Tsing Hua University)



11:15     Media Perspectives: East and West
              Ben Hedges (Journalist/ TV host)

11:30    Anti-Globalization Movements and Strategies in A 
              Global Context              
              Jason Wu (Asian American independent              
              organizer)
11:45    Q&A

Special thanks to the TSA at GC for the space!
259167584255001.name: From New York to Taiwan: Occupy Movements and Anti-Globalization

260034944168271.description:
This event brings together a diverse group of internationally recognized creators and editors for a discussion of the history and dynamics of women working in American comics. Panelists include women creators and editors of different generations including Raina Telgemeier, creator of Smile and Drama; Diane Noomin, creator of Glitz-2-Go and editor of the Twisted Sisters anthologies; Shelly Bond, Executive Editor of Vertigo comics; Alitha Martinez, a penciller and inker who has worked on Marvel's Iron Man, X-men, Black Son, Fantastic Four, and the Black Panther and currently WWE Superstars for Papercutz. Panelists will discuss the role of women in comic narratives, career advice, and personal history, followed by audience Q&A. The event is presented in conjunction with the Museum of Comic and Cartoon Art/Society of Illustrator's MoCCA Fest 2014, and is organized by SVA Career Development and Keith Mayerson, Cartooning Coordinator.

Space is limited; please register now. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sva-presents-strong-female-protagonists-panel-discussion-featuring-women-in-comics-registration-10209941209

http://www.shazam.com/discover/track/111562589

Let us know what you think of the song!! 
xox
Micah and the gang!

TORONTO -  It's been three years since Micah Barnes released his acclaimed third solo disc 2011's Domesticated, which resulted in rave reviews and standing room only crowds across the country for the singer-songwriter. Toronto native Barnes began his career gigging on Queen Street West as a youngster in the 1980's and has played around the world since then, notably as a member of famed a cappella quartet, The Nylons. Traveling back and forth between Toronto and New York City in recent years, his new album is inspired in part by his romance with New York City's musical history, resulting in his homage to the Cotton Club, Apollo Theatre and The Brill Building: "New York Stories." 
 
For this project Barnes has expanded his horizons, both as a songwriter an as a musician. "New York Stories" is a collection of originals and choice covers that represent Micah's departure from a solo piano act back to a larger group, notably featuring brother Daniel Barnes on drums and Russ Boswell on bass; the two also occasionally provide background vocals which adds greatly to the charm of this act. 
 
http://www.micahbarnes.com
https://www.facebook.com/micahbarnesmusic
https://twitter.com/micahbarnes

266394060196254.description:
[April 9th update]

Dear all,

We are excited so many people are interested in organizing the Ithaca-based regional queer conference! We hope you can come to the first open planning meeting this weekend, and please share this message or the Facebook event with anyone who might be interested (for reference, the original communication from March 10th has been added to the end of this message).

Saturday, April 12th, 10:30-12:30pm
105 Rockefeller Hall (Cornell campus)
Please see the following map for parking and wheelchair access information: http://goo.gl/eaZ2QF

We were hoping to hold this meeting downtown so that it would be more convenient for people coming from different areas, but we weren't able to secure a meeting space outside of Cornell in time. We apologize for any inconvenience this poses to anyone and will work with everyone on Saturday to come up with better meeting spaces in the future. Likewise, we tried to find a time that worked for everyone, but we had to settle for what offered least scheduling conflicts for the group as a whole. If you are unable to attend this meeting, do not fret! You will still be able to remain in the loop and continue to be involved.

At the meeting we will begin a community conversation about what we want this conference to be. Below is a tentative structure for the meeting, which will be facilitated by Bailey Dineen:

1. Brief introductions
2. Conversation: who is (and isn't) in the room, and what brings us here?
3. Goals of the conference
4. Initial discussion about logistics
5. Next steps

Please let Bailey know if you have any additions or modifications to the agenda or would like clarification (btd32@cornell.edu). This agenda is tentative, and we hope to allow the conversation ample room to be flexible so that we may explore the possibilities of the conference and our group, unrestrained and to the fullest. 

We hope to see you on Saturday!

Xiana García Freire
Stephanie Hobbs
Sam Naimi
Nathan Gelb-Dyller
Justin Kondrat
Betrearon Getachew Tezera
Bailey Dineen

**************************************************

[Original March 10th message]

To the Ithaca community,

We are a committee of Cornell students interested in planning an Ithaca-based regional queer conference for the next academic year. We are making an open call for anyone in the larger Ithaca community to become involved with the planning and implementation of this conference. There are many ways you can get involved! If you’re interested, please fill out this survey (http://goo.gl/uIykV9) by March 30th at 11:59pm (if this message reaches you after that date, please fill it out anyways! We want to hear from you!). After we receive responses, we will schedule an open planning meeting during the second weekend of April. The easiest way to help, however, is to forward this message along. We hope you can help us spread the word that way!

The conference is expected to be hosted at the Cornell campus and run from a chosen Friday night until the following Sunday evening. It will include activists, speakers and performers from the local, regional and larger communities, and it will be open to all, regardless of sex, gender, sexuality, age, class, (dis)ability status, citizenship or any other aspect. Some of the goals of the conference are:

- To include, welcome and represent all forms of queerness. By queerness we understand all kinds of divergences from norms around sex, gender, sexuality, intimacy, pleasure, love, relationships, family and kinship.
- To create a safe space for queer people in the area to meet each other and share their knowledge and experiences.
- To address intersecting and hierarchical forms of oppression as they play out within and without the queer community.
- To create an environment conducive to critical examination of ourselves, our communities and the larger society.

Once again, please let us know if you would like to be involved. This is an intersectional and inclusive conference, and we think it is necessary to represent as many diverse backgrounds and perspectives as possible, so we can together create a safe and long-awaited space in our region that caters to the needs of the queer community at large.

For any questions, please e-mail ithacaqueer@gmail.com.

Looking forward to hearing from you,

Bailey Dineen
Betrearon Getachew Tezera
Justin Kondrat
Nathan Gelb-Dyller
Sam Naimi
Stephanie Hobbs
Xiana García Freire
266394060196254.name: Join the planning of the Ithaca-based regional queer conference!

268341616658734.description:
Considerada una de las bandas más representativas de la escena alternativa latinoamericana en New York, “Consumata Sonidera”, tocará en Lima, junto a cinco bandas invitadas de Radio Dosis, lo mejor de su repertorio este 8 de abril en La Noche de Barranco.

Revista Dosis, como parte de promover la cultura en nuestro país, presenta desde “La Gran Manzana” a Consumata Sonidera, un grupo musical que tiene a dos integrantes peruanos bajo sus alas. 

Asimismo, esa noche contaremos con la presencia de las agrupaciones nacionales de Radio Dosis, como: Hamadría, Última Conexión, Akasia, Luminus Hearts y Red Route. Estas bandas, junto a Consumata Sonidera, prometen encandilarnos con sus fusiones de reggae, cumbia, balkan, punk, jazz, entre otros; pues logran retumbar, a punto de buena música, cada ciudad que les abre las puertas.

Sobre las bandas de Radio Dosis

Hamadría:
Si hablamos de metal tenemos que mencionar -sin pensarlo dos veces- a “Hamadría”, una agrupación que desde hace 10 años lucha por ser sobreviviente de un género al que ellos consideran el “más expresivo”. Su primer disco “Reina Azul” será lanzado este año. 

Última Conexión:
Este dúo nacional viene arrasando las tiendas digitales, pues su tema “Atrapada en los recuerdos” ya tiene buena acogida junto a su videoclip del mismo corte. Conformado por Jim Bravo y Ana Álvarez, “Última Conexión”, es el nombre de este nuevo dueto musical que sale a la luz con “Señal”, disco que contiene -como mayor atractivo-, un cúmulo de canciones producto de vivencias y amores a ritmo de pop con tinte británico.

Akasia: 
Una grupo formado desde el año 2006, tiene su primer álbum titulado “Re: Sonar”. Así también cuenta con un videoclip de la canción "Siento". Akasia, viene presentándose en diversos festivales de la colectividad japonesa en el Perú como Matsuri, frente a más de 10 mil personas; Softnyx Party, evento de videojuegos; Nippon Ganbare, concierto a beneficio del terremoto en Japón, entre otras. 

Red Route:
Bandas como “Red Route”, formada en diciembre del año 2012, no solo tocan para sentir la música, sino que viven el rock y transmiten a otros su mensaje en cada una de sus letras a través de distintos matices acústicos. En su poco tiempo de creación, han sido causales de notas en medios peruanos y en distintos puntos del mundo como Norteamérica, Europa y Asia, donde rotaron sus 3 primeros singles “Why Dont We Do It In The Road”, “Lo que Pueda Salir” y “LubiPop”.

Luminus Hearts:
El estilo balada-pop de Silvana Navarro y Josseline García (voces), transita por un estilo melódico,  tierno, romántico y sencillo. A ésta voz se unió Renzo Pacheco (violín, flauta, oboe) quien compone temas de soundtrack,  neo- orquestal y new age, con sonidos etéreos y épicos. Esta agrupación, fundada el 9 de setiembre del 2012, va acaparando cada vez más seguidores que buscan escuchar un estilo diferente.

Así que la explosión musical ya está asegurada con “Consumata Sonidera”.

¡No te lo puedes perder!

INGRESO LIBRE

274806422678454.description:
Tak ako aj po minulé roky, tak aj tento rok prídu náš Slovenský festival v USA spestriť svojim spevom a tancom folklórne skupiny zo Slovenska. Jednou z vystupujúcich skupín je aj Folklórna skupina Kečera zo severovýchodného Slovenska z malebnej dedinky Jakubany v okrese Stará Ľubovňa. Folklórna skupina Kečera Vás milo obdarí svojou úprimnosťou a autentickosťou v podobe kultúrneho zážitku a skupina DOMINO vás zabaví na ľudovej veselici. Kto má záujem aby FSk Kečera vstupovala v ich okolí, kontaktujte: 


Hanka: Hanka2820@gmail.com
Maryann: masivak@aol.com


Rusyni!
Naša reč ša ľitami zabyvat, rodiče svoji ďitočky učat hvariti po slovensky, našy rodaci žyjučy za hranicami postupni začynajut hvariti čudžom rečom. Nedopusťme, što by ša na našu krasnu rusinsku reč, kotru nam zanechali našy predkove, postupom času zabylo.


„Hej TY! Narode rusinskyj.
Nezabyvaj tot svyj jazyk materinskyj.
Bo jak hvarili vašy otec, mati:
Materine slovo je hrich zabyvati.
V rodnym seľi koreni vašy ostavajut,
keď ša vyberete do čudžoho kraju.
Keď aj vyletite iz hňizda rodnoho,
nezabuďte maťir i ňaňka svojoho!“


Folklorna skupina Kečera z Jakubian vystupyje so svojimi pasmami v rusinskym jazyku. Všytky pasma čerpajut z ľudovoj kuľtury jich predkyv, vyobrazyjut stary zvyky i tradiciji, z kotrych ša i teraz mnohy išti v dedini zachovali. Svoju autentickosť idut molody z FSk Kečery reprezentovati aj do USA.

276711045827927.description:
Enroll here: http://almaghrib.org/seminars/846
You know you've heard this dialogue before:
"You MUST follow a Madhhab!"
"You must NOT follow a Madhhab!" Huh?
"I only follow Abu Haneefah!"
"I only follow the Qu'ran, not humans!" Huh? "You must be a Wahhabi!"
"I don't even know what a Wahhabi is. You must be a blind follower!" Confused, huh?

Today, watch every coffee-shop-Islamic-debate and you'll see it wander into talk like that. Are you really supposed to follow a Madhhab and question nothing? Or is it that you should challenge everything regardless of your ability to read the Qur'an or not? What is a Madhhab anyway? Huh?

Pull your legs out of the confusion quicksand. Empower yourself with the new seminar by AlMaghrib Institute: The Code Evolved: Evolution of Fiqh. Where did our Fiqh come from? How did we arrive at our current state of understanding Islam?

You'll learn topics that include such things as the proper methodology in pursuing an authentic understanding of Islam. You'll study the blessed lives of the four Imams and appreciate who they really were. Before preaching to others, you'll understand for yourself first why there is such a thing as 'valid' differences of opinion. And through the Tawfeeq of Allah, if you are successful and sincere in your studies, your Eman will increase as your knowledge increases. 

A student can only grow in knowledge as tall as his or her teacher, in most cases. And because that is a law of the teacher-student relationship, AlMaghrib has raised the bar with Shaykh Yaser Birjas. InshaAllah, prepare ye to grow taller!

Previous AlMaghrib Accredited seminars sold out in New Jersey and Houston long before the actual event. Students had to be turned back due to limited space. And if you delay your registration, Shaytaan will have one more chance at preoccupying you so that you are later unable to attend... 

In times of change...
Learners inherit the earth,
While the learned
Find themselves beautifully equipped
to deal with a world
that no longer exists.

Who is this Seminar For?

-Students of knowledge who are eager to start their study of Fiqh with a solid foundation.

-Community leaders who need to understand the Fiqh back grounds of their multi-cultural communities.
 
-Muslims responsible for teaching Fiqh to young Muslims.
    
-Muslim lawyers seeking greater appreciation for the system and wisdom behind Islamic legislation.
    
 -New Muslims who, when confronted with the different opinions regarding Fiqh, are often left confused.
    
 -Anyone who's slogan is: "community unity" and needs to understand the ethics of disagreement and how - step by step - can other opinions be realistically tolerated.
    
 -Any Muslim who loves the great Imams of Fiqh and wants to re-visit their blessed lives and the story of their schools of thought.
   
 - Anyone wishing to make closer relationships with other community members who share a desire to improve themselves and serve this Deen.

At the end of this course you will be able to:

 -Begin your study of comparative Fiqh with confidence
   
 - Appreciate and share with others the blessed lives of the four Imams
   
 - Understand the reasoning behind different opinions
   
 - Carry on empowered dialogues with people of opposing views
   
 = Discuss issues of Fiqh with proper etiquette

Seminar Materials: And you won't go home empty-handed. You'll leave this course with credit towards a degree in Islamic Studies by AlMaghrib Institute; a binder with a summary of the lessons and handouts of the seminar; and step-by-step advice on how to implement what you’ve learned and carry it on to others. 

TIMINGS:

3 hours Friday night, 8-10 hours on Saturdays and Sundays, exact timings vary by city.

  -The session include a 10-minute break every 50 minutes.
  - The day is mixed with activities, discussions, and lecture.
  - The time includes a two-hour break in the early afternoon.
  - Don't let the hours scare you. AlMaghrib is different from marathon halaqahs that trigger memories of pain. InshaAllah, count on it.


Previous AlMaghrib seminars have sold out before the actual event. Students had to be turned back due to limited space. And if you delay your registration, Shaytan will have one more chance at preoccupying you so that you are later unable to attend...

Still Undecided?

Five more reasons why you will want to attend an AlMaghrib Seminar:

1. Our Instructors are among the best ... period. We are determined to provide our students with instructors who take professionalism, effectiveness and expertise to the max. Along with tremendous knowledge, our instructors are also engaging and exciting, so that our seminars will provide you with some of the most interesting days you’ve ever spent learning Islam.

2. We give you the most important, important information. There is a lot of knowledge out there that may take you years to gather on your own. In this two-weekend seminar, we'll give you what we believe is the best, most important information to help you enact Islam in the best way.

3. Practicality is emphasized. You will leave the seminar with specifics you can apply and teach to others immediately. We promise you results on your very next day back at home or work.

4. The value is unbeatable. If someone were studying to fix computers, they would pay in the thousands, justifying the price by the huge return they would receive if they found work. Our prices do not amount to even one-tenth of that, yet isn't professional and efficient instruction in our Deen more worthy of our money? Our enrollment fees can be justified by the huge return you’ll receive – even if you don’t find work.

5. Our guarantee is unconditional, straightforward and the very best in the field. How can we be so confident? Because we work hard before the seminar to make sure you're happy with you're results after the seminar. Pertinent, useful information you can use, a convenient location, registration that is easy, and instructors who grab your attention and take you on an exciting journey full of fun and facts. We believe you'll love every minute of it.

Now the question is:
What will you unbelievably be missing if you don't attend?

The first-annual Manhattan Madness event is a city-wide March Madness-style charity beer pong tournament that pits some of the biggest bars in NYC against each other in order to raise money for a good cause. Each bar will be representing a school and a cause/charity so grab a friend and sign up to play for your favorite school, bar, or charity.  

The Madness kicks off with the Regional Qualifier on Saturday April 5th so pick the bar where you would like to compete and see if you could make it through to the Tournament of Champions against the best teams from the other bars at a location TBD on Sunday April 6th. 

All you have to do is make it through your Regional Qualifier for the chance to bring home the $5,000 GRAND PRIZE! 

Everyone who competes will have access to food and drink specials at each participating bar on the day of the event and even if you don't make it to the Tournament of Champions, feel free to come out to support your bar, school, or charity. 

*IMPORTANT*!!: MAKE SURE TO JOIN THE TEAM OF THE BAR AT WHICH YOU ARE COMPETING OR YOU WILL NOT BE INCLUDED IN THAT BAR'S BRACKET AND WILL NOT BE ABLE TO COMPETE!

Competitors and spectators alike are strongly encouraged to have friends and family sponsor them in order to raise as much as money as possible for their charity. Those that raise the most money will be automatically entered to win a ton of awesome prizes. 


For updates about special guests, specials, prizes, etc. Follow @RealSeatSwap on Twitter

284451735043056.description:
STEFANO CANTO with Richard Kostelanetz’s audio work “New York City Oratorio”

Curated by Abbiatici_Levy
In collaboration with  Joe Ahearn

“Geography in contraction” is an itinerant project of the Italian artist Stefano Canto, that will be presented in different cities with a high density of building development, all around the world. Each stages is composed by 2 parts: a preparatory phase, in which the artist starts to explore the territory, recording environmental sounds and picking up natural elements such as leaves, sand, pieces of wood, plumes (…); and a second public phase in which, during a short performance, he uses all the collected elements and the rumours for creating a concrete cube, that is a kind of territorial data archive. 

Every block of cement and its corresponding audio constitute a geographical sampling, a fossil testifying the changing of natural spaces and urban zones, laying the foundation of a possible futuristic archaeology. At the end of the project, all the concrete cubes and their audio, which represent a contracted geography of the world, will be showcased in a solo exhibition summarizing all stages performed worldwide.  

What is immediately clear since one starts a New York’s territory exploration is that the natural landscapes are precisely circumscribed into the urban plan and completely functional to citizens needs. New York with its metropolitan area is the largest conurbation in United States and one of the most densely populated cities in North America. Characterized by a scarce availability of land, that is due to its coastal position, at the meeting of the Hudson River and the Atlantic Ocean, the New York's geography is an important contributing factor in generating the phenomenon of urban crowding. Environmental issues are chiefly concerned with managing population’s density, that is why, unlike the previous phases, the NYC’s stage of Geography in contraction will be devoted to the human geography.

In 1983, for the Metropolis series initiated by Westdeutscher Rundfunk, the American artist and writer Richard Kostelanetz realized a complex multilayered audio portrait of New York based upon his field recordings of sounds unique to the city. Though composed initially for radio broadcast, this audio portrait of New York City can be heard as a complex acoustic experience in live situations. Even if it was not in Kostelanetz’s intention, making his resounding portrait of the city the artist created a great auditive synthesis of New York’s human geography and Stefano Canto will use this exceptional sampling of city’s voices to realize a block of cement that will also contain different kind of human traces picked up all around the territory. 30 years after its first broadcasting, people attending the performance will have the possibilities of hearing the Richard Kostelanetz’s audio work. They also became part of the final recording process joining their voices to the sounds of New York City Oratorio and to the noises of concrete pastry draining into the cubic formwork.

The concrete cube will be a spatial and a temporal archive, at same time, leading the process of synthesis to its extreme consequences: cancelation of pluralities, dialectics ending and silence. 
 
STEFANO CANTO is an Italian artist, architect and designer based in Rome. His artistic research is focused on the semantic of the object and architecture, involving the relationship between natural environment, urban space and human interaction. His works often deal with sociological issues, questioning the natural sciences and the history. He is particularly interested in an urban science phenomenon known as «sprawl» or «spread city» which sees the uncontrolled development of metropolitan area to the detriment of the surrounding territory.
His works have been exhibited in many art galleries, institutions and museums such as: the MACRO, Museum of Contemporary Art of Rome; the MAXXI, Museum of XXI century; the Museum of the Design of Milan; the Civic Gallery of Modern Art in Spoleto; CORPO 6 gallery in Berlin; DATABASE, Carrara’s Civic Museum of Marble; the Wilson Art Centre and SUPEC of Shanghai. 

RICHARD KOSTELANETZ is an American writer, visual poet and conceptual artist born and based in New York City. Considered a major figure in American literary scene he has received a great number of awards and fellowships such as: Pulitzer fellow in critical writing, Guggenheim fellow; National Endowment for the Arts grants in visual arts and in media arts; American Society of Composers, Authors, and Publishers (ASCAP) Award, Ann Arbor Film Festival prize. Richard Kostelanetz has lectured and given readings of his poetry and fiction at numerous colleges and universities, including New York University, Cooper Union, Brown University, Harvard University, University of Iowa, Antioch College, Carnegie-Mellon University, University of Southern California, Rutgers University, Detroit Institute of Arts, and Barnard College. His works have been exhibited in more than 60 exhibitions all around the world. 

Born in 2011, ABBIATICI_LEVY is a curatorial duo based in Rome that is composed of Elena Abbiatici and Valentina Gioia Levy. Our attention is focused on experimental artistic research, crossing different fields such as: philosophy and sociology, music and science, poetry and literature, architecture and design (…) with a special regard to multimedia practices.  In particular we are reflecting on the effects that globalization, Web 2.0 and the climate changing have on single identities.

Abbiatici_Levy has been cooperated with: MACRO, Museum of Contemporary Art of Rome; VALLE Theatre Foundation (Rome); Fabio Paris Gallery (Brescia); Gloria Maria Gallery (Milan); Galleria ZAK, (Monteriggioni, Siena); Label201 Association (Rome); BT’F Gallery (Bologna); Swiss Institute (Rome); Délégation du Quebec (Rome); Canadian Embassy (Rome); OCA, Office of Contemporary Art of Norway (Oslo); RaiTunes, RaiRadio2; Astronomers Without Borders Organization (Sri Lanka).

JOE AHEARN is curator of performance and installation at Clocktower Gallery & Radio and a leading voice in the national network of underground music spaces. Since 2008, Ahearn has been resident curator at the Silent Barn, a premier underground music space, where he has curated innumerable music shows, book releases, and artist made video game exhibitions. Ahearn is also the Managing Director of Showpaper, a non-profit, bi-weekly arts and music newsprint with a 60-volunteer staff pool and a circulation of ten thousand. He is also Founder and Event Organizer of SleepWhenDeadNYC, a series of inter-organizational, multi-disciplinary, collaborative cultural events based in unusual locations throughout the city.

THE SILENT BARN is a multi-functional all-ages art incubation space in an outer borough of New York City. It operates a daily all-ages events venue, facilitating music, performing arts, and other events; it acts as an experimental sandbox for a wide variety of social and interactive projects; and it hosts a residency program for artists of all ages who may benefit from living directly at the center of public art and performance activity.





This project is made possible by Free Mobility - Ecodrive Flexibility. Eco-friendly electric mobility in Villa Borghese’s PARK Rome.

287103674777196.description:
New York Officially Unofficial Burn Festival

This is the official event page for the unofficial New York Burn. This event will be taking place on the weekend of May 29 - June 1.

I want a NONPROFIT TRANSPARENT VOLUNTEER-RUN SUMMER BURN FESTIVAL with CAMPING and an EFFIGY and I want it in NEW YORK.

This event will be taking place because I declared that it will be taking place so it WILL take place.

This will be more than just a weekend full of art, music, and the coolest people you have yet to meet! So much more is on the line! A new sense of community! Opportunities to make lifelong friends! Discovering new passions, music, art, people! To fall in love!

I need your help and your participation. Together WE will make this happen. Without you, this will be a few of my closest friends who feel obligated to pitch tents in my backyard (but it WILL still happen!). We need a Board of Directors. We need VOLUNTEERS. We need ART. We need MUSIC. We need WORKSHOPS. We need YOU.

This festival will be guided by the ten principles of Burning Man. The ten principles of Burning Man are:

Radical Inclusion, Gifting, Decommodification, Radical Self-reliance, Radical Self-expression, Communal Effort, Civic Responsibility, Leaving No Trace, Participation, Immediacy

WHO IS IN?! If you are interested in taking this on with me, please contact me!

Stay tuned for the survival guide and the ticket link!

288469554635324.description:
The Birdhouse Project is een project waarbij 30 vogelhuisjes zijn verdeeld over 30 kunstenaars waar na lang broeden 30 unieke kunstwerken uit zijn ontstaan. 

Door het brede scala aan kunstenaars zal aan het einde van deze vogelvlucht een enorme diversiteit aan kunstwerken te bewonderen zijn. Tijdens het Graphic Design festival 2014 zullen de huisjes zich nestelen in New York Creations.

Tijdens de expositie worden de vogelhuisjes geveild en kan er via de website www.thebirdhouseproject.nl op de kunstwerken geboden worden. De hoogste bieders gaan er met de vogelhuisjes vandoor en van de opbrengst gaat 20% naar de vogelbescherming en 80% naar de kunstenaars.
 
Wij nodigen jullie allemaal van harte uit om bij de aftrap van de veiling aanwezig te zijn op 17 april om 19:30. Maar ook op de andere dagen ben je van harte welkom om de huisjes te bewonderen en misschien zelfs wel trotse eigenaar te worden van een uniek kunstwerk!
288469554635324.name: The Birdhouse Project

288520911315707.description:
Directed by twice Oscar®-nominated filmmaker and NYU Alumna Lucy Walker, "The Crash Reel" is the dramatic story of one unforgettable athlete, Kevin Pearce; one eye-popping sport, snowboarding; and one explosive issue, Traumatic Brain Injury.

Location: Kimmel 914 -- 60 Washington Square South

This screening is part of a REACT to FILM National Moment where college campuses across the country will host events to generate dialogue and spark civic action. 

This eye-popping film seamlessly combines twenty years of stunning action footage with new specially-shot verité footage and interviews as it follows U.S. champion snowboarder Kevin Pearce and exposes the irresistible but potentially fatal appeal of extreme sports. 

An escalating rivalry between Kevin and his nemesis Shaun White in the run-up to the 2010 Olympics leaves Shaun on top of the Olympic podium and Kevin in a coma following a training accident in Park City, Utah. 

A very special guest panel will be discussing TBI following the screening.

Panelists include:

Uzma Samadani, MD. PhD. FACS.*
Chief Neurosurgeon New York Harbor Health Care System, Co-Director Steven and Alexandra Cohen Veterans Center for PTSD and TBI
Assistant Professor Departments of Neurosurgery, Psychiatry and Physiology & Neuroscience, New York University School of Medicine

Thomas Archer
Father of a child with a TBI
New Beginnings Community Center for Brain Injury Rehabilitation

Laurie Rippon
Chairperson of New York City Chapter of Brain Injury Association of NY State

John Kirkwood
John Kirkwood re-launched his business, CityMouse, Inc. as a USBLN®-certified disability owned business enterprise following an aneurism and critical stroke in 2006. Since his disabling brain aneurism, John has been an advocate for the disability and brain injury community.

Liz Giordano
CEO of the Head Injury Association, an independent, not-for-profit agency, widely recognized for its innovative programming for survivors of head injury and their families.

Presented By
REACT to FILM at New York University Chapter
www.reacttofilm.com

Official film website:
www.thecrashreel.com
288520911315707.name: REACT to FILM at New York University presents "The Crash Reel"

292520874230217.description:
WHAT IS THE "SAMBA PARTY"?

On April 26th, Samba New York! will be hosting its second "Samba Party," the only regular event in NYC where the general public can dance to a live samba school Bateria (Drum Section).

As opposed to a show, the "Samba Party" is our Open Rehearsal for the community—a kind of NYC take on the mega samba school rehearsals that precede Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro.

Brazilian dance master Danielle Lima will provide a lesson before leading the crowd in a series of fun and exciting samba routines, set to the powerful rhythms of Samba New York's live Bateria, under the leadership of Director, Philip Galinsky. DJ 2Melo sets the mood with his unique collection of Brazilian roots and contemporary dance tracks.

At this edition of the Party, Samba New York! will be holding its first ever "pagode," a typical samba get-together featuring a circle of musicians playing informally around a table, accompanied by singing, dancing, socializing, and plenty of food and drink.

To participate as an instrumentalist in the Bateria or pagode portions of the evening, just enroll in our Bateria Rehearsal and Pagode Samba courses.

For more information:

http://sambanewyork.com/samba-party
http://sambanewyork.com/bateria-rehearsal
http://sambanewyork.com/pagode-samba


ABOUT THE ARTISTS:

Praised by Brazil's Estado de São Paulo newspaper as "the most famous and active 'school of samba' in New York City," Samba New York! has brought the exhilaration and richness of Rio's samba traditions to some of the most prestigious venues, events, and media platforms in NYC and beyond—including Central Park SummerStage, the WITNESS Gala hosted by Peter Gabriel, the Best Buy Theater in Times Square, Brooklyn Museum, Joe's Pub, SOB's, TV Globo's O Jornal Nacional, the Dr. Oz Show, and the CBS Early Show. Having grown up immersed in Rio's samba world, Danielle Lima is one of NYC's foremost Brazilian dancers and founder of the Brasileirando Dance Group. Myk 2Melo is a global bass DJ and founder of Cumba Mela.
292520874230217.name: Samba New York's Next Samba Party

EDMVibes Presents:  The Manhattan Project 

LIVE at Water Street Music Hall

Join us as for an ALL ROCHESTER group show! National touring talent from your hometown; The Manhattan Project combined with your local favorite DJ Papi Chulo and a first ever LIVE performance from an extremely talented duo SCHWAGGZ!

================================
April 26, 2014
Doors @ 7:00pm
18+
Tickets ON SALE NOW: 
http://bit.ly/TMProc
================================


The Manhattan Project (Live Electronic Dance Music): www.themanhattanprojectlive.com
www.facebook.com/themanhattanprojectlive 

Since exploding on to the scene in 2010, The Manhattan Project has become one of the fastest growing live electronic duos in the northeast. TMP continues their sonic-boomtronic assault in 2014, blowing up clubs, amphitheaters, festival main stages, and after-parties across the country! Drawing influences from house, dub, drum n bass, techno, and lounge, The Manhattan Project brings sophistication to the dance floor with their original compositions, high energy beats and mind melting textures. Armed with an arsenal of keyboards, synths, electronic and acoustic percussion, they seamlessly merge analog and digital sounds to create a sonic style all their own.

High energy shows, spot-on covers, and clever live remixes of popular artists, movie themes, and the obscure, have gained TMP the reputation of a must-see live act! Their music features the pulsating beats of a DJ, with the power and feel of a full band, as they gain loyal fans through word of mouth and incredible live shows.The Manhattan Project has shared the stage with Disco Biscuits, Lotus, Big Gigantic, Paper Diamond, Future Rock, Conspirator, , Jimkata, BioDiesel and more!


SCHWAGGZ
Rochester natives Ryan Daggs and Jordan Schwartz collaborate to bring you that true new.  Future bass, trap, neurohop and glitch fuzed into one distinct sound accompanied by live drums and sampling.  First a DJ set followed by their first official performance, playing a handful of original tunes as well as the latest from the influences that helped create Schwaggz.


Papi Chulo
Has emerged this year as the region's most versatile and thought-provoking genre-clash DJ. Through his total reinvention of the local party game with his co-management of RIPROC, this has served as the catalyst to spread his emerging definition-defying presentation of sound that discriminates no genre, producer, frequency, or BPM from the digital realm. Drum & Bass, Dubstep, Electro House, Glitch-Hop, Moombahton, Hip-Hop, IDM... he can play to any crowd.


Promotional Support:
RIPROC
Rochester Rave Community

296310780525485.description:
Ritorna in Italia, in esclusiva per l'Istituto di Gestalt HCC Italy, la dott.ssa Ruella Frank, autrice del libro Il corpo consapevole, fondatrice del modello somato-evolutivo gestaltico!

Sentiamo che ci muoviamo in un mondo che si muove attraversandoci. Questo processo interattivo è la dimensione intersoggettiva della soggettività. Ed è basato sulla risonanza cinestetica - il riverbero dei toni emozionali generati da una persona all’altra. Attraverso lezioni, esperimenti di movimento, dialoghi e dimostrazioni, verrà esaminato il processo della risonanza emergente – il sentire relazionale – e verrà esplorato il modo in cui “ascoltiamo con il nostro corpo” l’essere con l’altro, per poi sapere che siamo qui.
Verrà inoltre presentato lo sviluppo delle risonanze cinestetiche all’interno della diade primaria genitore-bambino e la loro implicazione nella progressione posturale e dei gesti, che è la base per il funzionamento psicologico adulto.

Docente
Ruella Frank
New York Institute for Gestalt Therapy, USA

http://www.gestalt.it/chi-siamo/visualizza-cv-docente.php?docente=678

Programma
La docente sarà tradotta simultaneamente dall’inglese all’italiano
Sabato 10 Maggio 2014
- Le transazioni non verbali nell’organizzazione dell’esperienza
- Lezione. Lo sviluppo della risonanza cinestetica nelle diade genitore-bambino e terapeuta-paziente
- Esperimento di movimento, dialogo
- Lezione. Dimostrazione clinica e dialogo

Domenica 11 Maggio 2014
- Schemi di movimento fondamentali: la base del funzionamento psicologico
- Lavori in piccoli gruppi. Report nel grande gruppo
- Lezione. Esperimento di movimento. Feed back e dialogo: La risonanza cinestetica e lo sviluppo della situazione terapeutica
- Lezione e presentazione di un caso. Esperimento in piccoli gruppi: integrare la risonanza cinestetica nella supervisione in gruppo.
- Feedback e dialogo. Dimostrazione clinica.

Scarica la brochure del workshop

http://www.gestalt.it/contents/457_brochure.pdf

Destinatari
Il workshop è a numero chiuso ed è rivolo a psicologi, medici, psicoterapeuti e professionisti del movimento corporeo.

Attestato e crediti ECM
Alla fine del workshop verrà rilasciato l’attestato di partecipazione al “Workshop internazionale. Il corpo consapevole: sviluppo del sè e risonanza cinestetica con Ruella Frank”.
Il corso rilascia n. 21 crediti ECM per tutte le professioni.

Location
Camplus Living Turro - Via Stamira d’Ancona 25, raggiungibile tramite la metro MM1 linea rossa, fermata Turro
E' possibile pernottare presso la stessa struttura usufruendo di uno sconto speciale, garantito dall'hotel.
E' inoltre possibile cominciare a scopire la città di Milano, gli eventi e i percorsi culturali, attraverso questo link
http://www.turismo.milano.it/

Bibliografia consigliata
IL CORPO CONSAPEVOLE
Un approccio somatico ed evolutivo alla psicoterapia
Autore: Ruella Frank

QUADERNI DI GESTALT 2013/1, VOL. XXVI
L'esperienza corporea in psicoterapia

Per acquistare i testi scrivere a: info@gestalt.it

Iscrizioni e costi
Entro il 5 Aprile 2014
Il costo del workshop è di € 330,00
Per allievi, ex allievi e soci SIPG € 300,00

Dopo il 5 Aprile 2014
Il costo del workshop è di € 350,00 per tutte le categorie.

I prezzi includono IVA e crediti ECM

Info e iscrizioni:
Invia richiesta di iscrizione all'evento o richiedi informazioni tramite questo link
http://www.gestalt.it/iscrizioni-corsi-psicologia-psicoterapia-eventi-ecm-medici.php?id_evento=457
Per assistenza: info@gestalt.it

300096406808022.description:
April 4 - 27th // Splatterpool 138 Bayard St. Brooklyn 11222
Gallery Hours: Saturday and Sunday 12-7pm or by appointment.

Splatterpool and PopUp Art Shop are proud to present A Voice Calls From Nowhere, a group exhibition curated by Victoria Duffee.

Six artists are featured contributing works that confront the everyday experiences of physicality. In each of these the figure is purposefully omitted, in order to create something closer to an impression of perspective. The diverse approaches in media, brought together, speak to a blurred  line between art making and documentation — recording the experience of having a body.

A smoking cigarette, with lipstick on it, in an ashtray in an empty room; stinky shoes in an open gym locker; a tooth on the sidewalk… These are all moments we might encounter in our lives that let us know that someone was just here. All of these lead us through a synchronicity of occurrences in life that disassociates us from memory.

ARTISTS:
Brian Balderston
Juan Betancurth
Alberto Borea
Florencia Escudero
Diana Lozano
Myles Starr

ABOUT PopUp Artshop:
Popup Artshop is a collective network of exhibitions. One of the exhibitions was an enormous survey featuring 100 NYC ARTISTS, an exhibition curated by Maria Dieppa, was taken to Barranquilla, Colombia, last February. 100 NYC ARTISTS returned back to New York through a serious of smaller exhibitions curated by the same artists in the show within the pool of the 100 artists. This is the 3rd exhibition, this time in collaboration with Splatterpool artspace.
300096406808022.location: Bayard St between Manhattan Ave and Graham Ave, Brooklyn, New York
300096406808022.name: A VOICE CALLS FROM NOWHERE

303955619729096.description:
One of New York’s busier exports, Aaron James has spent the last 15 years rocking parties at home and across the globe. He is sought after by some of the most influential personalities and organizations in the world. 

Most  recently, Aaron came off an extended India stay touring and performing with such wildly diverse acts as Tomcraft (World #1 Progressive Trance DJ), Pitbull, Australia’s Havana Brown, The Netherland’s Bart Claessan, musician Graeme Hamilton (UB40/Fine Young Cannibals), and two of the country’s top Electronic acts Midival Punditz and Shaa’ir + Func.  

He’s opened in concert / collaborated with the likes of Elton John, Lil' Kim, Eminem, Groove Armada, John Digweed, The Wailers, PM Dawn, Michael Fronte, ?uestlove (The Roots), Poet Named Life (Black Eyed Peas); post-concert for Pet Shop Boys, N.E.R.D., The Pretenders, and Detroit Techno legend Juan Atkins.  As well, he’s rocked parties for Barack Obama’s presidential campaign, then Senator Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump, Paul McCartney, Tony Bennett, Lucianno Pavarotti, Russell Crowe, Derek Jeter (New York Yankees), Ron Wood (Rolling Stones), David Copperfield, pornstar Jenna Jameson, and renown artist David LaChapelle.

On tour he opened for and/or collaborated with The Beastie Boys, Sheryl Crow, Eve, TV On The Radio, Santigold, Bootsy Collins, Talib Kwele, Jack Johnson, Bow Wow, Solange Knowles, Hawthorne Heights, Jazmine Sullivan, Buckethead, Tenacious D., actors Jack Black, Ben Stiller, Laura Dern, as well as Ms. America, and Robert F. Kennedy Jr., among others.

As well his corporate client list is extensive. Aaron manned the decks for media giants MTV, ABC, NBC, the NBA, Playboy, GQ, Vogue, Maxim,Elle, The Wall Street Journal, Marie Claire, Harper’s Bazaar, Travel & Leisure, as well as Black Book, Interview, and Gear magazines; and worked events for Calvin Klein, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Donna Karan, DKNY, Diane von Furstenberg, Prada, Giorgio Armani, A/X, Miss Sixty, Tommy Hilfiger, Marc Jacobs, Esprit, Puma, Kenneth Cole, Anne Klein, Marithe & Girbaud, Nautica, Facconable, Asprey, Bulgari, MAC, Estee Lauder, Shiseido, Redken, Ferrari, Mercedes Benz, Veuve Cliquot, Grand Marnier, and many others.  He also headlined film premieres for ‘Sex and the City 2’, ‘Something’s Gotta Give’, ‘Men In Black 2’, ‘Crash’, ‘Big Fish’, ‘A Beautiful Mind’, and ‘Catch Me If You Can’.

This is a groundbreaking event for Intactivism, and we hope you will join us in the cities nearest you. Veteran intactivist & writer Jonathan Friedman, Newsletter Editor and Webmaster of Attorneys for the Rights of the Child, is the co-organizer of this event. The co-sponsors include Intact New York, DelMarVa Area Intactivists, Intact Maryland, Intact Massachusetts, Intact Rhode Island & New York City NYC Circumcision Resources. Here is the schedule:

1. NYC - Saturday the 16th November - Times Square NYC, 46th & 7th Ave where Broadway intersects it-  Rain or Shine, 10am - 3pm

365409926933255.description:
Ready to unplug, leave your devices behind and experience pure joy, timelessness, and a renewed connection to your self, others and the Earth?Ready to log off the “Web” and log on to the natural Web of Life?

Join us for this unique all-outdoors experience on 200 acres of pristine Shawangunk foothills in NY’s Mid-Hudson Valley.We will disconnect to reconnect, leaving behind our computers, cell phones, social media, clocks, credit card info and adult cares… and trade them in for wild games, barefoot wandering in the woods, tracking wild animals, spending time in solitude, cooking over an open fire together and sleeping under the stars.

Through it all, we will create a community together, playing, learning, cooking, eating, singing and storytelling. You will have the opportunity to remember your original instructions, to remember yourself, and say YES to life.

“The Original Instructions celebrate our interdependence and interconnection with the diversity of life and one another. They help us remember who we are, that we are all Indigenous to a place not so many generations ago.”   Kenny Ausubel, Original Instructions

http://www.truenature.org/original-instructions-adult-nature-connection-program.html

380518092088119.description:
You are invited to a one night only exhibition of new work
AMY MYERS:Natal Curve

Thursday, May 1st 6pm-10pm

Hosted by Eileen S. Kaminsky, ESKFF and RandallScottProjects

Exhibition Location:
Rox Gallery
86 Delancey Street
New York
corner of Delancey and Orchard

Amy Myers’ intricate large-scale works on paper originate out of her fascination for the understanding of theoretical physics. The daughter of a physicist, Myers grew up immersed in the language and discourse of searching and theorizing a problem. It lead her into creating work that explored the ideas of structure within the universe and how structure can give way to chance and chaos. 

Myers drawings seek understanding to these questions through a continuous stream of thought. Her progression while calculated and specific, like the science she favors is guided by creating new possibilities, or directions while in mid flow. The intuitive decisions she makes within the drawing are expanded upon, like a theory. Every mark created becomes a part of the process, whether negated, or expanded on. Some of her marks are left alone, stranded, almost as if waiting to be picked up again, leading to a new direction, a new theory or phrase.

Working within a “train of thought” Myers’ drawings often create an interwoven symmetrical design pattern that appears like a mirror image. This dualism can call into play the science and the philosophy of life, questions she often poses, or seeks to understand. Within this context a sub-context emerges. Her drawings often take on organic shapes, most often the female form. Myers attributes this to the intimacy she develops with the paper and the medium. Drawing is a tactile gesture, in the course of finishing a piece she touches the paper thousands of times, guiding her hand within the fluidity of the mark, moving in close to create the minute details within its structure. This physicality in form relays a spirituality, an opposite, dualistic counterpart to the structure of the science the drawing is based on.
380518092088119.name: Amy Myers: Natal Curve in New York

 New York Nights - jeden Mittwoch!

 Seit mehr als vierzehn Jahren lädt Pamela Falcon jeden Mittwoch zur "New York Nights" ins Riff. Hi its Damion Gordon , I created this page so i can post Everything about BRICKS . from Events to Episodes Please join 

BRICKS- Is a reality show about 9 gay guys working in New York City striving to make their dreams and careers come true in THE BIG APPLE. These guys are In search of love,life and success.

With the struggles that black gay people have in terms of seeing themselves depicted in the media, The opportunity to be involved with a project that was solely focused on showcasing us.

For one intense and drama-filled month back in April & May cameras followed nine gay black men of various ages and career paths as we lived our lives, followed our dreams, and got to know one another. The result is Bricks, a docuseries about nine gay, black guys living and working in New York City striving to make their dreams come true.

Deep-House-Techno-

New York Transit Authority

Rory Gallagher

Hawie

Advance tickets only 250baht-MOTD

NYTA hails not from the Big Apple, but from Bristol, UK. His real name is
Mensah Anderson, who is also the seasoned producer that you probably know
simply as Mensah. The NYTA guise focuses on being a fresh outlet for his
120 – 130bpm 80′s Electro, House & Techno influenced tracks & creations.

The ‘New York Transit Authority’ name was first adopted for a split 12″
release with Conqueror (Redlight) on Redlight’s Lobster Boy label last
year. His side was a slinky, 808 house number entitled ‘Off The Traxx’,
which deservedly found its way into FACT’s 50 best tracks of the year & was
caned by a wide range of top DJs across the globe – including Joe Goddard,
Loefah, Redlight, Boddika, Jackmaster, Disclosure, Pearson Sound, Benji B &
Giles Peterson to name just a few.

NYTA has already proven himself as a talent on the decks with sets across
the world & two exclusives mixes: one for Dazed & Confused & ‘the one’ for
FACT mag that finished in the top 20 best FACT mixes of the year

432165736886478.description:
It's that time of year again! The Potsdam Humane Society will be having their 5th Annual "Strut Your Mutt' on Saturday May 3rd at the Sandstone Arena (on Pine Street just before the shelter).
Events Include: 

5K Walk- Time to Strut! Strut ! The 5th Annual Strut Your Mutt offers a relaxed, family-friendly atmosphere with breaks along the way. This 5K has 4 water stops for dogs and people. Every dollar raised will help PHS care for many animals each year through it's lifesaving programs, including: adoption, cruelty investigation, emergency rescue, reuniting lost animals with their owners, low cost spay and neuter programs, and PHS's "Pets for Vets" Program. This year PHS has been lucky to not have a particular animal in need of costly medical expenses, so this year a portion of the proceeds will benefit PHS's "Pets for Vets" fund. Pets for Vets is a new program for the shelter- EVERY approved ACTIVE DUTY or RETIRED Military Veteran can adopt a pet for FREE! This is one way PHS helps give back to those who have so honorably served our Country- and Now You can Too! No pets at home? No problem! Many people Strut with family and friends! Cat Fancier? We've got that covered too! Many people can walk in honor of their cat as well- we wouldn't want them associating with those ruff ruff ruffian dogs anyway.. 
Want to walk as a family group or with your co-workers or friends? Start a Team and choose a team name... How about Muttley Crue?! 
Going to be out of town? You can still mail in a donation or sponsor a team! Contact the Potsdam Humane Society for more information.
Registration is 8:30-9am- walk starts 9AM Sharp! 
Over the years PHS has collected many donations from local businesses for prizes- 50 Plus! So there are many chances for you to win! 
Eligibility is by pledge sheet or donation. Print out the pledge sheet- OR create your own! For more information contact the Potsdam Humane Society (315) 265-3199

CRAFT SHOW- 9:00AM-3:00PM- Free admittance!

10x10 spaces are available for ONLY $10! Call PHS at (315) 265-3199 to reserve your space(s)!


ALSO - there will be a food truck and DJ -Jody Tosti! We will also have face painting for the kids!

NEW THIS YEAR: 

Breezy Maples Farm will be at Strut with pony rides and farm animals!! 

Come and see a LIVE chainsaw carving by Terry McKendree!

Pet Photo Contests! Contact PHS for more information and how to submit a photo of your pet! 

*KICKBALL TOURNAMENT! Do YOU think you've got what it takes?! Form a team and we shall see! Join us for this fun-filled tournament starting May 3rd at 12noon! Cost is $50.00 per team. The winning team will receive half of the proceeds from the tournament along with a coveted trophy! Pre-Registration is required by April1st. Call PHS and sign up! (315) 265-3199.

Stay Tuned! More to come! 
If you have any questions or would like more information- please contact the Potsdam Humane Society
 (315) 265-3199.
432165736886478.name: Potsdam Humane Society 5th Annual "STRUT YOUR MUTT"!

DIVINE DIAMOND METHODS FOR EVOLUTIONARY HEALING

This Healing and Clearing process utilizes all three modalities together. We will open with Quantum cellular reprograming to create greater longevity, vitality and Divine connection.

The Divine Diamond Quantum Star Trinity Field is pure Grace!  A manifestation of Divine Love, a rose, blue and violet Divine gold of Multidimensional Consciousness is a gift from the Divine, and knows our Hearts desires.  It is an expression of Divine Consciousness, and is here for Humanity, and the Earths evolutionary healing and transformation of the collective consciousness. 
The Universal Law of Love is the guiding principle of the Divine Diamond Healing. Each time you participate in the healing processes, you, your loved ones, and the world are greatly benefited, and the more you give the more you receive!  Through our intention, the Diamond will assist to send healing to our own self or other people and places. The extension of our bodies and lives extend beyond the physical form and can affect our human pathology, which is the source of many diseases. Therefore the Diamond does not use our energy; it simply rearranges itself Divinely within, through, and around us, bringing out our radiance and enriching our lives with extraordinary inner Peace. 
The Diamond is inexhaustible and can work with precision on each individual completely unlimited by location and is not diminished, but enhanced, by group participation. 
We simply sit or lay down closing the eyes and initially direct our attention towards grounding deeply into the Earth, and opening and connecting through our Hearts. The energy is invited using the invocation, and assisted by the group healing Facilitator.
We enter into an awakened state of the Divine Heart, where we are connected to that pure Divine Source from which all healing is received. No experience is necessary. The work is about giving each individual a personal experience of his or her own Divine connection.

The e-Lybra® 9
This unique Bio-Resonance system is utilized for individual one hour healing sessions with Aniruddhan. The machine is connected to the client, allows direct communication with their autonomous consciousness, and will read, report, and restore any physical, mental, emotional, or spiritual imbalances.  
Never before in the history of mankind has technology evolved to such a degree that it is now possible to work at this level of consciousness, and to make a change to a bio-chemical organism such as a human. 

VortexHealing®
The philosophy of VortexHealing® is that all of life; One (One Source, One Consciousness, One Divinity), expressing itself as this amazing experience of creation. But because we have lost the awareness of that, we have become caught up in all kinds of issues that generate disease in our bodies and suffering in our hearts. 
Our basic experience of life is one of separation, of experiencing ourselves as a particular being that is essentially separate from everything else in creation and separate from the Universal Source of creation. This creates all kinds of issues and false identities that, over time (and lives), imprint or condition every level of our human system—our bodies, our minds, our emotions and even our sense of spirituality. The web of this conditioning is incredibly, almost unimaginably deep, completely distorting our experience of being human. It creates all kinds of emotional distortions and blockages in our human energy system, which generates weakness and physical disease. 
The intent of VortexHealing® is to release this conditioning on every level it is found, returning the person to emotional balance and energetic strength, so that health prevails.

$45 per person

436642886472593.description:
:: LIVE ::

BIG DADDY KANE ( JUICE CREW / RAP LEGEND / NEW YORK )

:: DJ SUPPORT ::

JAYROE ( THE SMELLS / BERLIN )

:: PARTNER ::

HHV.DE
BURGERAMT

Big Daddy Kane ist einer der letzten seiner Art. Der Hip Hop Pionier traf in den späten 80igerner auf Biz Markie und zusammen mit Marley Marl gründeten sie die legendäre Juice Crew. Mit seiner ersten Soloplatte Long Live The Kane brach er alle Verkaufsrekorde und ging als einer der ersten Rapkünstler auf Platz 1 der US Charts.  Besonders mit dem Hit Smooth Operator baute er sein Image als Playboy und Sexsymbol aus. 

Für internationales Aufsehen sorgte er mit den provokanten Privatbildern von Madonna und Naomi Campbell. Trotz der riesigen Medienaufmerksamkeit nahm er  es sich nicht, einige der besten Raptracks in der Geschichte aufzunehmen. Zudem kamen interessante Kooperationen mit Teddy Riley und Barry White zustande, die seinen Legendenstatus weiter ausbauten. Eine weitere Rap Ikone wird die Cassiopeia Bühne heilig sprechen und verdeutlichen, wie wichtig das Cassiopeia für die Hip Hop Kultur in Berlin ist, war und bleiben wird.



▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

Lasst einfach euren Namen und die E-Mail-Adresse da und schon seid ihr rundum informiert und verpasst nie wieder eine Veranstaltung aus unserem vielseitigen Programm. Über den Newsletter verlosen wir auch Gästelistenplätze und andere tolle Sachen. Ihr werdet sehen, dass euer Leben mit dem Newsletter ein Stück weit besser sein wird, als ohne!
